title: IRS-Commissioned Report Responds to Criticism Over Free File Program
text:
A new study commissioned by the Internal Revenue Service responded to intense criticism of the alliance between the agency and commercial tax-preparation companies. The report, obtained by The Wall Street Journal, pointed to shortcomings of the free online tax-preparation program, known as Free File, but concluded that its benefits remain substantial.

The public-private partnership, called the Free File Alliance, provides free online tax-prep by a dozen companies to about 100 million filers who currently earn about $66,000...
description: The study, obtained by The Wall Street Journal, pointed to shortcomings of the free online tax-preparation program, known as Free File, but concluded that its benefits remain substantial.
